message.content:
Below is a worked‐example of how one can arrive at (and then build) the two structures exactly as shown, using only the blocks/orientations in the second (dictionary) image.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DESCRIPTION OF THE MAIN (TARGET) IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  There are two separate “towers”:

A)  The Left Tower (6 blocks total):
   –  Five horizontal “layers,” from bottom to top:
      1.  A green rectangular bar at the very bottom.  
      2.  A red cube.
      3.  A blue cube.
      4.  Another red cube.
      5.  A second green rectangular bar at the top.
   –  Along the full height on one side is a tall yellow rectangular block (spanning from the bottom green bar to the top green bar).

B)  The Right “House” (8 blocks total):
   –  Five horizontal layers again, from bottom to top:
      1.  Two blue cubes side by side on the floor (forming two “legs”).
      2.  A short yellow rectangular bar bridging across those two blue cubes.
      3.  Two cubes side by side (blue on the left, red on the right).
      4.  A green rectangular bar laid across the top of those two cubes.
      5.  Two orange triangular wedges forming a peaked roof (left and right).

•  In total, 14 blocks are used (6 in the left tower, 8 in the right “house”).
•  Each structure stacks upward in a clear “layer‐by‐layer” arrangement.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
To match both color and orientation exactly (no rotating beyond what is pictured), these are the required blocks (block indices refer to the second image’s labels):

●  Left Tower (6 blocks):
   1)  Green bar (#7) – used for bottom
   2)  Red cube (#4)
   3)  Blue cube (#1)
   4)  Red cube (#4) again
   5)  Green bar (#7) – used for top
   6)  Tall yellow vertical bar (#9) along the side

●  Right House (8 blocks):
   1)  Blue cube (#1) – bottom left
   2)  Blue cube (#1) – bottom right
   3)  Short horizontal yellow bar (#8) – spans the two bottom blue cubes
   4)  Blue cube (#1) – middle layer (left)
   5)  Red cube (#4) – middle layer (right)
   6)  Green bar (#7) – across the top of these two cubes
   7)  Orange triangular wedge (#13) – left half of the roof
   8)  Orange triangular wedge (#14) – right half of the roof

Hence the total list of dictionary‐block indices (with repetitions where needed) is:
•  #1 (blue cube) × 4  
•  #4 (red cube)  × 3  
•  #7 (green bar) × 3  
•  #9 (yellow tall bar) × 1  
•  #8 (yellow short bar) × 1  
•  #13 (orange triangle) × 1  
•  #14 (orange triangle) × 1  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  PROPOSED ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is one logical bottom‐to‐top sequence.  Simply list the moves in order:

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 7   // Left Tower bottom green bar
  Step2:  Move block with index 4   // Left Tower lower red cube
  Step3:  Move block with index 1   // Left Tower blue cube
  Step4:  Move block with index 4   // Left Tower upper red cube
  Step5:  Move block with index 7   // Left Tower top green bar
  Step6:  Move block with index 9   // Left Tower tall yellow side piece
  
  Step7:  Move block with index 1   // Right House bottom-left blue cube
  Step8:  Move block with index 1   // Right House bottom-right blue cube
  Step9:  Move block with index 8   // Right House yellow bridge piece
  Step10: Move block with index 1   // Right House middle-level blue cube
  Step11: Move block with index 4   // Right House middle-level red cube
  Step12: Move block with index 7   // Right House green bar on top
  Step13: Move block with index 13  // Right House left orange roof wedge
  Step14: Move block with index 14  // Right House right orange roof wedge
}

Following these steps (without reorienting any blocks beyond how they appear in the dictionary image) will reproduce the main target structures exactly.
